name: places/ChIJk6Vh4wFZwokREcvGXSPuOsk
formattedAddress: 40 E 45th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 40 E 45th St, New York, NY 10017-3190, USA

editorialSummary.text: Store offering equipment & apparel for tennis, racquetball, squash & more, plus stringing services.

originalText.text:
If you are looking for a tennis/squash stringing service, here is the place near Grand central station. Actually, one of the shops is located in the grand central. You drop off the racket in the morning, you can pick it up evening.

Every stringer is very knowledgeable, friendly and professional. You can ask them and find out the best stringing or tention.

There is another stringing shop in the midtown, but I really love this place. Maybe, it's because of their friendly attitude.

text.text:
If you are looking for a tennis/squash stringing service, here is the place near Grand central station. Actually, one of the shops is located in the grand central. You drop off the racket in the morning, you can pick it up evening.

Every stringer is very knowledgeable, friendly and professional. You can ask them and find out the best stringing or tention.

There is another stringing shop in the midtown, but I really love this place. Maybe, it's because of their friendly attitude.

originalText.text: These guys are great. Woody and mark care a lot about ny squash and are a presence at local squash events. They are invested in the success of streetsquash, the harlem squash program for kids for which I work. We do most of our stringing in-house now, but they used to give us a good discount and string quickly despite our being a low priority. If you have any issues, just ask to speak to either woody or mark. They are straight shooters.

originalText.text: This is the best, of many very good, tennis shops & high quality, racquet stringing establishments in New York City. Centrally located, the staff are extremely knowledgeable, dependable and a pleasure to work with. We are a tennis playing family and Grand Central Racquets strings all of our racquets and has been our primary source of tennis equipment and accessories for over a decade. More than just a shop, Woody has successfully built the gem of tennis retailing in New York, evidenced by his recent expansion with the much larger location at 157 West 35th Street in addition to the shop at the National Tennis Center. Mark Teague works closely with us to make sure our equipment is optimized for the courts, so much so, that we consider him our "Primary Care Physician" for tennis. Mark serves as a trusted adviser on every aspect of equipment and has been a indispensable resource. Our son is moving rapidly up the standings of the his age group in the Eastern Section of the USTA and we consider Woody, Mark and the people at Grand Central Racquet genuine partners in his success.

originalText.text: The guy was kind, but extremely late in his service after he repeatedly asked me not to be late for the pick up! Not recommended

originalText.text: Everytime I come to NYC I go to Grand Central Terminal and get a ham or turkey & cheese crossaint. Sooooooo good!
